creator: bstout@ventaso.com
text:
In the below build file, "init" target gets called twice.  My understanding is 
targets will only get called once.  Happens on solaris and NT.

<project name="test" default="night" basedir=".">
	<target name="init">
		<echo message="init"/>
	</target>
	<target name="jar" depends="compile" >
		<echo message="jar"/>
	</target>
	<target name="compile" depends="init" >
		<echo message="compile"/>
	</target>
	<target name="war" depends="jar" >
		<echo message="war"/>
	</target>
	<target name="night" depends="jar">
		<echo message="Running"/>
		<antcall target="war">
		</antcall>
	</target>
</project>


Here's the output:
Buildfile: make\test.xml

init:
     [echo] init

compile:
     [echo] compile

jar:
     [echo] jar

night:
     [echo] Running

init:
     [echo] init

compile:
     [echo] compile

jar:
     [echo] jar

war:
     [echo] war

BUILD SUCCESSFUL

Total time: 0 seconds

creator: steve_l@iseran.com
text:
when you do an antcall all the dependent targets get re-evaluated within the 
new context (property settings) of the the ant call. 

This is by design. Once you recognise the behaviour you can use it to your 
advantage.

creator: steve_l@iseran.com
text:
Actually I think this should be re-opened because the documentation in antcall 
isnt explicit enough, so its really a docerror, even if behaviour is 'as 
intended'. So someone needs to improve the antcall page, and this bug report 
can serve as a reminder.
